channel.title: unsupervised-learning on Lil'Log
channel.description: Recent content in unsupervised-learning on Lil'Log

item.title: Learning with not Enough Data Part 1: Semi-Supervised Learning
item.description: When facing a limited amount of labeled data for supervised learning tasks, four approaches are commonly discussed. Pre-training + fine-tuning: Pre-train a powerful task-agnostic model on a large unsupervised data corpus, e.g. pre-training LMs on free text, or pre-training vision models on unlabelled images via self-supervised learning, and then fine-tune it on the downstream task with a small set of labeled samples. Semi-supervised learning: Learn from the labelled and unlabeled samples together.

item.title: Contrastive Representation Learning
item.description: The goal of contrastive representation learning is to learn such an embedding space in which similar sample pairs stay close to each other while dissimilar ones are far apart. Contrastive learning can be applied to both supervised and unsupervised settings. When working with unsupervised data, contrastive learning is one of the most powerful approaches in self-supervised learning. Contrastive Training Objectives In early versions of loss functions for contrastive learning, only one positive and one negative sample are involved.

item.title: Self-Supervised Representation Learning
item.description: [Updated on 2020-01-09: add a new section on Contrastive Predictive Coding].
